intro: Sida pseudocymbalaria, commonly known as the small-flowered sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sida pseudocymbalaria is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
